snippet: T-Mobile, the smallest of the Big Four cellphone carriers, steps away from the two-year, unbreakable contract that Sprint, Verizon and AT&T live by.
abstract: David Pogue State of the Art column; T-Mobile, smallest of Big Four cellphone carriers, steps away from two-year, unbreakable contract that Sprint, Verizon and AT&T live by; customers can buy phone outright, or pay it off over time; three different plans come with unlimited calls and can save customers a lot of money compared with rivals.
lead_paragraph: T-Mobile, the smallest of the Big Four cellphone carriers, steps away from the two-year, unbreakable contract that Sprint, Verizon and AT&T live by.

headline.seo: T-Mobile Breaks Free of Cellphone Contracts and Penalties
headline.main: Breaking Free of the Cellphone Carrier Conspiracy
headline.print_headline: T-Mobile Breaks Free Of Carrier Conspiracy
